page.title: 02BURGHLEY: WOODLAND WALK
page.content: We arrived at Burghley park and quickly got into groups and were shown where to go.Looking through a gate we saw a dark muddy track.Our job was to measure ten metres then identify trees.When we were walking through the wood it felt like the trees were going to fall on us because it was very windy.In the wood it smelt of animal droppings.Then a little further on it smelt very fresh.It was terribly overgrown with nettles and cow parsley .There were lots of dead trees around. When we got into the wood we saw a hare,and some baby pheasants trying to fly.About half way into the woods we came across a clearing.It was a Roman road called Ermine street.After the clearing was a big muddy puddle which Julia got stuck in.Nearby we found a pheasants egg shell.
